targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  ceph_volumes.created_at AS "time",
  (ceph_volumes.usedsize/ceph_volumes.totalsize::float)*100,
  openstack_volumes.device AS metric
FROM ceph_volumes
INNER JOIN openstack_volumes
ON ceph_volumes.id = openstack_volumes.id
  AND openstack_volumes.status = 'in-use'
  AND openstack_volumes.server_id = '$Instance_ID'
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(ceph_volumes.created_at)
ORDER BY 1,2

panels.description: The amount of memory, that can be quickly reclaimed without additional I/O (in bytes).Typically these pages are used for caching files from disk.
panels.title: Memory Disk Caches

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  ceph_volumes.created_at AS "time",
  ceph_volumes.usedsize,
  openstack_volumes.device AS metric
FROM ceph_volumes
INNER JOIN openstack_volumes
ON ceph_volumes.id = openstack_volumes.id
  AND openstack_volumes.status = 'in-use'
  AND openstack_volumes.server_id = '$Instance_ID'
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(ceph_volumes.created_at)
ORDER BY 1,2

panels.title: Disk Volumes Used Size in GB

panels.description: Number of Read and write requests from/to block device
panels.title: Disk R/W Requests IOPS

panels.description: Total time in seconds spent on cache flushing to a block device
panels.title: cache flush to block device
